improbable that the clotting mechanism could have evolved through natural
selection.
Yet we should think carefully about the ways in which the pertinent prob-
abilities are calculated. Behe is relying on two general ideas about probabil-
ity. One is the thought that, when events are independent of one another, the
probability that both will occur is the product of the individual probabili-
ties—if you toss a fair die twice,
